synthesize module

Created on Fri Jul 14 13:46:08 2023

@author: hjammoul The aim of this file is to Synthesize images for testing. functions are:

draw_shape generate_color_img generate_img_contrast_difference_effect generate_img_shape_size_difference_effect get_slice Construct_disk_SE

synthesize.construct_disk_SE(Value, size_of_SE, shape_size, background=(0, 0, 0))[source]

Create a flat structuring element (SE) in the shape of a disk.

Parameters:

  • Value (tuple) – CIE Lab coordinates for the disk color.

  • size_of_SE (int) – Size of the square SE (odd value).

  • shape_size (int) – Size of the disk.

  • background (tuple, optional) – RGB color for the background, by default (0, 0, 0).

Returns:

The generated flat SE.

Return type:

SE (numpy.ndarray)

Example

SE = Construct_disk_SE((L, a, b), 9, 9, (255, 255, 255))

synthesize.draw_shape(img, x, y, shape_size, shape_type, shape_color)[source]

Draw a shape on an image.

Parameters:

  • img (numpy.ndarray) – The image on which the shape will be drawn.

  • x (int) – The x-coordinate of the shape’s position.

  • y (int) – The y-coordinate of the shape’s position.

  • shape_size (int) – The size of the shape.

  • shape_type (str) – The type of shape (‘triangle’, ‘square’, or ‘circle’).

  • shape_color (tuple) – The RGB color of the shape.

Returns:

img (numpy.ndarray)

Example

# Draw a blue square at position (50, 50) with a size of 30 pixels. draw_shape(img, 50, 50, 30, ‘square’, (0, 0, 255))

synthesize.generate_color_img(height_img=200, num_shapes=10, shape_min_size=40, shape_max_size=40, mode='CSOMP', img_background_color=(0, 0, 0), target_color=(255, 255, 255))[source]

Generate an RGB image with different shapes (triangles, crosses, circles) of different colors. The image is used for testing CMOMP and CSOMP. The SEs will be drawn in the image. :param height_img: Height and width of the image. :type height_img: int :param num_shapes: Number of shapes to generate. :type num_shapes: int :param shape_min_size: Minimum size of shapes in pixels. :type shape_min_size: int :param shape_max_size: Maximum size of shapes in pixels. :type shape_max_size: int :param mode: ‘CSOMP’ or ‘CMOMP’ to generate one or two SEs. :type mode: str :param img_background_color: RGB color for the background. :type img_background_color: tuple :param target_color: RGB color for the target shape in CSOMP mode. :type target_color: tuple

Returns:

The generated RGB image. se_img (numpy.ndarray) in RGB: The structuring element (SE) image in CSOMP mode. se_inf_img (numpy.ndarray) in RGB: The inferior structuring element (SE) image in CMOMP mode. se_sup_img (numpy.ndarray) in RGB : The superior structuring element (SE) image in CMOMP mode.

Return type:

img (numpy.ndarray) in RGB

Example

img, se_inf_img, se_sup_img = generate_color_img(height_img=200, num_shapes=10, shape_min_size=40, shape_max_size=40, mode=’CSOMP’,

img_background_color=(0, 0, 0),target_color = (255,255,255))

synthesize.generate_img_contrast_difference_effect(height_img=50, img_background_color=(0, 0, 0), target_color=(0, 0, 230), num_circles_per_line=5, circle_radius=8, noise_std=0)[source]

Generate an image with circles of varying colors and contrast differences. The variationss are manually set inside the definiton in case u might need to change them.(arrays: blue variations, red variations…) They’re variations for each RGB channel. :param height_img: Height of the generated image, by default 50. :type height_img: int, optional :param img_background_color: RGB tuple representing the background color of the image, by default (0, 0, 0). :type img_background_color: tuple, optional :param target_color: RGB tuple representing the color of the first circle, by default (0, 0, 230). :type target_color: tuple, optional :param num_circles_per_line: Number of circles per line, by default 5. :type num_circles_per_line: int, optional :param circle_radius: Radius of the circles, by default 8. :type circle_radius: int, optional :param noise_std: Standard deviation of noise to add to the image, by default 0. :type noise_std: int, optional

Returns:

The generated RGB image with circles of different colors. se_inf_img (numpy.ndarray): The generated RGB image of the SE_inf circle with color variations. se_sup_img (numpy.ndarray): The generated RGB image of the SE_sup circle with color variations.

Return type:

rgb_img (numpy.ndarray)

Example

img_rgb, se_inf_rgb, se_sup_rgb = generate_img_contrast_difference_effect(height_img=150, img_background_color=(0, 0, 0),

target_color=(0, 0, 230), num_circles_per_line=5, circle_radius=8, noise_std=0)

synthesize.generate_img_shape_size_difference_effect(height_img=50, img_background_color=(0, 0, 0), target_color=(0, 0, 230), num_shapes_per_line=5, initial_shape_size=6, target_radius=12, noise_std=0)[source]

Generate an image with different shapes and their size variations.

Parameters:

  • height_img (int, optional) – Height of the generated image, by default 50.

  • img_background_color (tuple, optional) – RGB tuple representing the background color of the image, by default (0, 0, 0).

  • target_color (tuple, optional) – RGB tuple representing the color of the shapes, by default (0, 0, 230).

  • num_shapes_per_line (int, optional) – Number of shapes per line, by default 5.

  • initial_shape_size (int, optional) – Initial size of the shapes, by default 6.

  • target_radius (int, optional) – Radius of the target shape, by default 12.

  • noise_std (int, optional) – Standard deviation of noise to add to the image, by default 0.

Returns:

The generated RGB image with different shapes and their size variations. se_inf_img (numpy.ndarray): The generated RGB image of the SE_inf shape with size variations. se_sup_img (numpy.ndarray): The generated RGB image of the SE_sup shape with size variations.

Return type:

rgb_img (numpy.ndarray)

Example

img_rgb, se_inf_rgb, se_sup_rgb = generate_img_shape_size_difference_effect(height_img=50, img_background_color=(0, 0, 0),

target_color=(0, 0, 230), num_shapes_per_line=5, initial_shape_size=6, target_radius=12, noise_std=0)

synthesize.get_slice(image_file, z)[source]

Get a slice from a Mice heart image in TIFF format.

Parameters:

  • image_file (str) – Path to the TIFF image file.

  • z (int) – Slice number to retrieve.

Returns:

The specified image slice as a 2D numpy array.

Return type:

slice (numpy.ndarray)

Example

slice = get_slice(path_to_img , 150)
